metadata.title: Thursday, 13th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many drivers are currently employed at the Mongu College of Education by:
(i)    the Government; and (ii)    the College Board;
(b)    when the drivers at (a) were employed; and
(c)    if the Government has not employed any driver at the College, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    when the sale of emeralds within Zambia commenced;
(b)    what benefits have been derived from the exercise; and
(c)    whether the policy of selling emeralds within the country will be revised.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication whether the Government has any plans to construct bridges across the following rivers in Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (b)    Mumbezhi on Kalengelenge road in Senior Chief Mukumbi’s area; and
(b)    Mafwe in Chief Matebo’s area.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    why the Government closed the only school for the disabled at Chilolwa in Nakonde District;
(b)    where the pupils have been taken to following the closure of the School;
(c)    what the cost of running the School, per annum, was prior to its closure; and
(d)    when the School will be reopened.
(a)    how much maize the Food Reserve Agency procured from farmers using the maize for fertiliser barter system for the 2013/2014 farming season;
(b)    how much maize the Agency bought for the strategic reserves;
(c)    whether the farmers were paid within ten days of delivery of the maize;
(d)    if not, why the farmers were not paid;
(e)    when the farmers will be paid; and
(f)    what other crops the Agency purchased from the farmers country-wide.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many teachers’ houses were earmarked for construction country-wide from January, 2008 to December, 2011; and
(b)    how many houses have since been completed.
(a)    when the Government will rehabilitate the Police Camp in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency which is in a deplorable state;
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a new police camp in the Constituency; and
(c)    if so, when construction of the new police camp will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when Kyafukuma Agricultural Training Institute in Solwezi will be rehabilitated.
Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when construction of classrooms and staff houses at the following schools in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency will commence:
(i)    Mitwi; (ii)    Sikundu; (iii)    Litoma; (iv)    Lushi; and
(v)    Lupo;
(b)    when Salao Primary School in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency will be rehabilitated; and
(c)    why it has taken long to rehabilitate the School.
(a)    how much publicity was done about the source of the Zambezi River as a tourist attraction before and after the UNWTO General Conference that was held in August, 2013; and
